SEARCH
Package Photos71.src.gui.controller

Class AlbumController

java.lang.Object
Photos71.src.gui.controller.AlbumController
All Implemented Interfaces:
LogoutController, Navigatable
public class AlbumController extends Object implements Navigatable, LogoutController
Controller for the album view in the photo album application. This controller handles the interactions within the album view, such as adding and removing photos, navigating between photos, and managing photo tags and details.
Author:
Yash Puranik, Joseph Arrigo

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AlbumController()
    Initializes the AlbumController with default settings for the file chooser.

  • Constructor Details

    • AlbumController

      public AlbumController()
      Initializes the AlbumController with default settings for the file chooser.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize() throws MalformedURLException
      Initializes the controller class. Called after the FXML fields have been injected. Prepares the album view with the photos and sets up listeners for UI interactions.
      Throws:
      MalformedURLException - if the path to the photo file is incorrect.

    • addTag

      public void addTag(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Handles the action of adding a tag to a photo.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.

    • removeTag

      public void removeTag(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Handles the action of removing a tag from a photo.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.

    • moveUp

      public void moveUp(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws MalformedURLException
      Moves the selected photo up on the album's photo list.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.
      Throws:
      MalformedURLException - if the path to the photo file is incorrect.

    • moveDown

      public void moveDown(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws MalformedURLException
      Moves the selected photo down in the album's list view. If the selected photo is the last one, it won't do anything.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.
      Throws:
      MalformedURLException - if the path to the photo file is incorrect.

    • addPhoto

      public void addPhoto(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException, MalformedURLException
      Adds a new photo to the album. The user is prompted to choose a file, and if a file is selected, it is added to the album and the album view is updated.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there's an error reading the file.
      MalformedURLException - if the path to the photo file is incorrect.

    • removePhoto

      public void removePhoto(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws MalformedURLException
      Removes the currently selected photo from the album and updates the list view.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.
      Throws:
      MalformedURLException - if the path to the photo file is incorrect.

    • addCaption

      public void addCaption(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws MalformedURLException
      Adds a caption to the selected photo based on the user input from the caption text field.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.
      Throws:
      MalformedURLException - if the path to the photo file is incorrect.

    • movePhoto

      public void movePhoto(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws MalformedURLException
      Moves the selected photo to another album. If the copy operation is successful, the photo is then removed from the current album.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.
      Throws:
      MalformedURLException - if the path to the photo file is incorrect.

    • copyPhoto

      public Boolean copyPhoto(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Copies the currently selected photo to another album chosen by the user. If the photo already exists in the target album, an error is displayed and no action is taken.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.
      Returns:
      True if the photo was successfully copied, false otherwise.

    • nextPhoto

      public void nextPhoto(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Selects the next photo in the album's photo list view.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.

    • previousPhoto

      public void previousPhoto(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Selects the previous photo in the album's photo list view.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.

    • logOut

      public void logOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      Logs out the current user and returns to the login view.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during logout.

    • search

      public void search(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Initiates a photo search within the current album.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.

    • goBack

      public void goBack(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      Returns to the previous view, typically the non-admin user's album list view.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the scene transition.

    • addKeyToPreset

      public void addKeyToPreset(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Adds the input tag's key to a user-specific list of preset keys to quickly add later.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.

    • addKeyFromPreset

      public void addKeyFromPreset(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Prompts the user with a Choice Dialog to determine which of their preset keys they would like to add to the currently selected photo's key input.
      Parameters:
      e - The event that triggered the action.
